From: Gabriel Jacobo <gabriel@...>

Habla uno que sabe mas que todos nosotros juntos.

We chose D3D over OGL because Epic's D3D drivers are in better shape
than the OGL ones. Two tech programmer's jobs for the remainder of the
project is to do one thing - make DNF scream under DX8 and
GeForce/GeForce 2 class cards.

DNF currently runs well under DX8 and we're doing things like bringing our
particle systems and other visuals over from Glide. The editor is now D3D
only and software rendering has been dropped from the engine (with a slight
speed boost). It's out goal to have Glide totally exercised by E3 or before
and be pure D3D with everyone running on GeForce 2's. That's completely
realistic.

By moving to DX8 we gain access to new features we can take advantage of.
We're not going to have time to do it all, but there is a possibility of
things like bump mapping on characters, and some vertex shader effects. These
are things that Glide prohibited, but are fairly simple in DX8.
